treatment.description: Subshrubs or shrubs, 2–10 × 3–10 dm. Leaves cauline 1/2 or more length of flowering stem; petiole 0.5–1 cm; blade lanceolate to oblanceolate or elliptic, 1–4 × 0.5–1.5 cm, usually densely tomentose on both surfaces, sometimes floccose and greenish adaxially. Inflorescences 3–10 cm; branches tomentose to floccose. Involucres 1–2 × 1–1.5(–2) mm. Flowers 1.5–2.5 mm; perianth usually pale yellow to yellow, sometimes white, glabrous. 2n = 40.
treatment.habitat: sandy to gravelly or clayey flats
treatment.discussion: Variety glutinosum is the common yellow-flowered expression of the species. It occurs in Arizona (Coconino, Mohave, Navajo, and Yavapai counties) and Utah (Beaver, Emery, Garfield, Iron, Kane, Washington, and Wayne counties). Yellow-flowered plants in Garfield and Wayne counties of Utah might be better assigned to var. corymbosum.
